intro: Chionolaena breweri, commonly known as the silverleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, silver-gray leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, oval seeds in achenes. Chionolaena breweri is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
